HomePage.title: INSIGHT LAWFIRM
HomePage.descrition_detail: The law office has been in service for over 30 years, offering comprehensive legal services. It is an organization founded by a group of professional lawyers with extensive and diverse legal experience. Our team includes experts in criminal law, civil and commercial law, intellectual property law, administrative law, family law, tax law, and more. We prioritize dedicated service and strive to ensure customer satisfaction and delight, focusing on providing valuable legal consultation and problem-solving for our clients. This unique management approach has earned us recognition as a legal advisor to various companies, organizations, and government agencies.
HomePage.our_team_detail: We are a team of experienced attorneys with expertise in various areas of law. With a commitment to providing the best service to our clients, our team consists of knowledgeable and skilled lawyers with extensive legal experience. We believe in offering straightforward and high-quality advice to help our clients make confident decisions at every stage of the legal process.
HomePage.contact_detail: For inquiries about our services, advice, and consulting on accounting, registration, and legal matters, we are happy to assist you.

AboutPage.title: INSIGHT LAWFIRM
AboutPage.title_detail: Committed to Excellence in Legal Services

our_history.title: Our History
our_history.indent_1: Our firm was founded in 1992 by a group of visionary and experienced lawyers. We are committed to building a law office that not only provides comprehensive legal services but also emphasizes professionalism. We strive to raise our service standards to be recognized internationally, meeting the diverse needs of clients in every sector.
our_history.indent_2: Over the past 30 years, we have devoted ourselves to developing the capabilities of our legal team, particularly in building expertise across various fields of law, both domestically and internationally. This ensures that our clients receive accurate and up-to-date advice. We also prioritize privacy and place great importance on protecting our clients' interests.
our_history.indent_3: We have had the opportunity to serve a wide range of clients, including government agencies, private entities, multinational corporations, and individuals. All of our clients receive high-quality, standard services, and we are prepared to address legal issues and provide in-depth consultations, allowing clients to plan and make decisions with confidence.
our_history.indent_4: We are proud of the trust clients have placed in us over the years, and we are ready to continue our stable growth. We are committed to improving our organization and services to build confidence as a comprehensive law firm and as a reliable partner in every aspect of law for our clients.

principle.title: Our Working Principles
principle.detail_column_1: Uphold the principles of justice and professional ethics
principle.detail_column_2: Build confidence and trust with clients

ContactPage.title: Contact
ContactPage.title_detail: Happy to give legal advice to you

CriminalPage.title: Criminal Cases
CriminalPage.title_detail: Basic knowledge about criminal cases, types of offenses, punishments, and legal procedures

tab_overview.title: What is a Criminal Case?
tab_overview.detail: A criminal case is a case involving an act of wrongdoing punishable by criminal law, where the state is the victim and the offender is penalized according to the law.
tab_overview.subtitle_detail_1: It involves actions that disrupt public order and peace.
tab_overview.subtitle_detail_2: There are criminal penalties, such as imprisonment or fines.

subtab_overview.title: Criminal Penalties
subtab_overview.result_description_4: Penalty imposed as a monetary fine

tab_procedure.title: Criminal Case Procedures
tab_procedure.subtitle: Statute of Limitations in Criminal Cases
tab_procedure.topic_detail_1_2: • Offenses with imprisonment over 7 years: 15 years
tab_procedure.topic_detail_2_1: • Offenses with imprisonment up to 7 years: 10 years

criminalTypes.title: Crimes Against Life
criminalTypes.description: Crimes committed against the life of others, such as murder, or causing harm leading to death.
criminalTypes.punishment: Imprisonment for 15-20 years, life imprisonment, or the death penalty.
criminalTypes.examples: Premeditated murder, involuntary manslaughter, causing death through bodily harm.

criminalTypes_2.title: Crimes Against the Person
criminalTypes_2.description: Crimes committed against the physical body of others, such as assault.
criminalTypes_2.examples: Assaulting another person, causing serious bodily harm.

criminalTypes_3.title: Crimes Against Property
criminalTypes_3.description: Crimes committed against another person's property, such as theft, robbery, and burglary.

procedures_1.title: Filing a Complaint
procedures_1.description: The victim files a complaint with the police to proceed with legal action against the offender.

procedures_2.title: Investigation
procedures_2.description: The investigating officer collects evidence to prove the crime.

procedures_3.title: Lawsuit Filing
procedures_3.description: The public prosecutor files a lawsuit in court.

procedures_4.title: Trial
procedures_4.description: The court examines the evidence and renders a judgment.

CivilPage.title: Civil Cases
CivilPage.title_detail: Basic knowledge about civil cases, types of offenses, punishments, and legal procedures

tab_overview.title: What is a Civil Case?
tab_overview.detail: A Civil Case is a case involving disputes between individuals or organizations regarding rights and obligations, such as claims for property or violations of rights, without being related to criminal offenses.
tab_overview.subtitle_detail_1: Disputes between individuals or organizations regarding rights and obligations
tab_overview.subtitle_detail_2: No criminal penalties, focusing on compensating damages
tab_overview.subtitle_detail_3: Remedies involve compensation or compliance with claims

subtab_overview.title: Penalties in Civil Cases
subtab_overview.result_description_1: Compensation in the form of money or property to the harmed party
subtab_overview.result_description_2: An order for the parties to comply with the contract or its terms
subtab_overview.result_description_3: Returning property that was seized or harmed by wrongful acts
subtab_overview.result_description_4: A prohibition on certain actions, such as preventing the violation of rights

tab_procedure.title: Procedure in Civil Cases
tab_procedure.subtitle: Statute of Limitations in Civil Cases
tab_procedure.topic_detail_1_1: • Disputes regarding property or contracts: 10 years
tab_procedure.topic_detail_1_2: • Damages from violation of rights: 5 years
tab_procedure.topic_detail_2_1: • Breach of contract or failure to comply with agreements: 2 years

civilTypes.title: Property-related Cases
civilTypes.description: Cases involving claims to property rights, such as lawsuits for the return of property or claims for damages due to violation of rights
civilTypes.punishment: Compensation for damages or return of property as ordered by the court
civilTypes.examples: Lawsuits for the return of seized property, lawsuits for compensation from breach of contract

civilTypes_2.title: Contract-related Cases
civilTypes_2.description: Cases involving breach of contract or failure to comply with agreed terms
civilTypes_2.punishment: Enforcement of contract terms or compensation for damages according to the contract
civilTypes_2.examples: Lawsuits to enforce contract terms, lawsuits for damages due to non-compliance with contracts

civilTypes_3.title: Rights Violation Cases
civilTypes_3.description: Cases arising from violations of personal or property rights, such as defamation or copyright infringement
civilTypes_3.punishment: Compensation for damages or cessation of rights violations
civilTypes_3.examples: Lawsuits for intellectual property violations, defamation lawsuits

procedures_1.title: Filing a Lawsuit
procedures_1.description: The injured party files a lawsuit in court to claim rights or damages

procedures_2.title: Investigation and Gathering of Evidence
procedures_2.description: Both parties gather evidence to support claims or to deny allegations

procedures_3.title: Negotiation and Mediation
procedures_3.description: Consideration of negotiation or mediation to resolve the dispute without litigation

procedures_4.title: Case Hearing
procedures_4.description: The court reviews evidence and makes a judgment based on the law

TaxPage.title: Tax Cases
TaxPage.title_detail: Introduction to Tax Cases, Types of Offenses, Penalties, and Legal Procedures

tab_overview.title: What is a Tax Case?
tab_overview.detail: A tax case involves issues related to tax evasion or non-payment of taxes as required by law, including cases of intentional tax evasion or failure to provide proof of tax payment.
tab_overview.subtitle_detail_2: May involve tax evasion or concealment of information

subtab_overview.title: Tax Penalties
subtab_overview.result_description_1: Payment of fines according to the rates prescribed by law
subtab_overview.result_description_2: Imprisonment as ordered by the court in cases of severe tax violations
subtab_overview.result_description_3: Order to pay back taxes or fines as per the court's ruling

tab_procedure.title: Tax Case Legal Procedures
tab_procedure.subtitle: Statute of Limitations in Tax Cases
tab_procedure.topic_detail_1_1: • Tax evasion involving large amounts: 10 years
tab_procedure.topic_detail_1_2: • Concealment of income or assets: 5 years
tab_procedure.topic_detail_2_2: • Failure to file tax returns: 3 years

taxTypes.title: Tax Evasion
taxTypes.description: Offenses related to tax evasion or failure to file accurate tax returns
taxTypes.punishment: Fines or imprisonment as prescribed by law
taxTypes.examples: Tax evasion on income, concealment of business income

taxTypes_2.title: Concealing Tax Information
taxTypes_2.description: Failure to disclose accurate information on tax documents or providing false information
taxTypes_2.punishment: Fines for unpaid taxes or imprisonment
taxTypes_2.examples: Concealing business income, providing false information about income or assets

taxTypes_3.title: Filing Incorrect Tax Returns
taxTypes_3.description: Filing incorrect or incomplete tax returns, such as incorrect data entry or miscalculating taxes
taxTypes_3.punishment: Fines or correction of tax filings
taxTypes_3.examples: Incorrect tax data entry, filing incorrect types of tax returns

procedures_1.title: Tax Inspection
procedures_1.description: Tax officials review the tax payment information of individuals or businesses

procedures_2.title: Filing a Tax Case
procedures_2.description: Tax authorities file a lawsuit in court if tax violations are found

procedures_3.title: Negotiation or Mediation
procedures_3.description: Negotiation or mediation between tax authorities and taxpayers to resolve tax violations

procedures_4.title: Court Review
procedures_4.description: The court reviews the case and imposes penalties according to tax laws

SpecialInvestigationPage.title: Special Investigation Cases
SpecialInvestigationPage.title_detail: Basic knowledge about special investigation cases, types of crimes, punishments, and legal procedures

tab_overview.title: What are Special Investigation Cases?
tab_overview.detail: Special investigation cases involve crimes that are harmful to public safety or national security, such as financial fraud, money laundering, human trafficking, or terrorism.
tab_overview.subtitle_detail: Key Characteristics of Special Investigation Cases
tab_overview.subtitle_detail_1: Involves crimes that affect public security or national security
tab_overview.subtitle_detail_2: Special investigators have special powers to investigate the cases
tab_overview.subtitle_detail_3: Can take action under special laws to protect the public interest

subtab_overview.title: Punishments in Special Investigation Cases
subtab_overview.result_description_1: Sentencing based on the severity of the crime
subtab_overview.result_description_2: Fines determined by the court as financial punishment
subtab_overview.result_description_3: Seizing assets obtained from illegal activities

tab_procedure.title: Legal Procedures in Special Investigation Cases
tab_procedure.subtitle: The process of legal proceedings in special investigation cases
tab_procedure.topic_detail_1_1: • Corruption in government or agencies: 10-20 years
tab_procedure.topic_detail_1_2: • Money laundering or human trafficking: 15 years
tab_procedure.topic_detail_2_1: • Tax fraud or improper tax filings: 5-10 years

specialInvestigationTypes.title: Financial Corruption
specialInvestigationTypes.description: Crimes related to financial fraud or deceit, such as fraud or covering up corruption
specialInvestigationTypes.punishment: Imprisonment or fines as determined by the court
specialInvestigationTypes.examples: Embezzlement of company funds, corruption in government agencies

specialInvestigationTypes_2.title: Money Laundering
specialInvestigationTypes_2.description: Money laundering is the process of making money obtained from criminal activities appear as though it is earned legally
specialInvestigationTypes_2.punishment: Imprisonment and fines as determined by the court
specialInvestigationTypes_2.examples: Transferring money from illegal sources to banks to conceal the origin of the funds

specialInvestigationTypes_3.title: Human Trafficking
specialInvestigationTypes_3.description: Human trafficking is forcing individuals to work or engage in abusive acts in an illegal manner
specialInvestigationTypes_3.punishment: Long-term imprisonment and fines as required by law
specialInvestigationTypes_3.examples: Trafficking people for prostitution, forced labor

procedures_1.title: Investigation of Special Investigation Cases
procedures_1.description: Special investigators gather evidence and conduct investigations to prove criminal activity

procedures_2.title: Filing Special Investigation Cases
procedures_2.description: Prosecutors file a case in court to take legal action against the offenders

procedures_3.title: Negotiation or Mediation
procedures_3.description: Negotiations or mediation may be conducted to resolve any disputes related to the criminal activity

procedures_4.title: Case Trial
procedures_4.description: The court proceeds with trial and judgment based on the laws relevant to special investigation cases

InheritancePage.title: Inheritance Cases
InheritancePage.title_detail: Basic knowledge about inheritance cases, types of crimes, punishments, and legal procedures

tab_overview.title: What are Inheritance Cases?
tab_overview.detail: Inheritance cases involve the transfer of property from a deceased person, which may include disputes over the division of the inheritance or wrongful actions such as embezzling the deceased's assets.
tab_overview.subtitle_detail_1: Involves the division of assets following death
tab_overview.subtitle_detail_2: May arise from disputes over the will or inheritance
tab_overview.subtitle_detail_3: Wrongful acts may include embezzling or concealing inheritance

subtab_overview.title: Punishments in Inheritance Cases
subtab_overview.result_description_1: Filing a lawsuit to divide the deceased's assets according to the law
subtab_overview.result_description_2: Wrongful actions in embezzling or concealing the deceased's assets
subtab_overview.result_description_3: Transferring inheritance to an incorrect person according to the law

tab_procedure.title: Legal Procedures in Inheritance Cases
tab_procedure.subtitle: Statute of Limitations in Inheritance Cases

inheritanceTypes.title: Embezzling Inheritance
inheritanceTypes.description: Actions related to embezzling or concealing the deceased's assets
inheritanceTypes.punishment: Embezzling inheritance may result in criminal penalties such as imprisonment or fines
inheritanceTypes.examples: Embezzling assets from inheritance, concealing the actual inheritance

inheritanceTypes_2.title: Incorrect Transfer of Inheritance
inheritanceTypes_2.description: Transferring inheritance to someone who is not legally entitled to it
inheritanceTypes_2.punishment: Civil penalties or court judgments may apply
inheritanceTypes_2.examples: Transferring inheritance to someone not entitled under the law

inheritanceTypes_3.title: Lawsuit for Dividing Inheritance
inheritanceTypes_3.description: Filing a lawsuit to divide the assets left by the deceased among the heirs
inheritanceTypes_3.examples: Requesting the division of inheritance from heirs who refuse to divide according to the law

procedures_1.title: Filing an Inheritance Claim
procedures_1.description: The heir who is entitled to the inheritance files a claim to divide the inheritance in court

procedures_2.title: Gathering Evidence
procedures_2.description: Gathering evidence to prove the right to inherit

procedures_3.title: Lawsuit or Negotiation
procedures_3.description: Filing a lawsuit or negotiating to divide the inheritance or compensate for damages

procedures_4.title: Case Review
procedures_4.description: The court reviews the case and decides on the inheritance-related lawsuit

FamilyPage.title: Family Cases
FamilyPage.title_detail: Introduction to Family Cases, Types of Offenses, Penalties, and Procedures

tab_overview.title: What are Family Cases?
tab_overview.detail: Family cases involve family-related issues such as divorce, alimony claims, adoption, and property division.
tab_overview.subtitle_detail_1: Involves relationships and roles within the family
tab_overview.subtitle_detail_2: Can have both legal and emotional impacts on those involved
tab_overview.subtitle_detail_3: Often includes mediation before entering court proceedings

subtab_overview.title: Penalties in Family Cases
subtab_overview.result_description_2: Claims for child or spousal support
subtab_overview.result_description_3: Division of assets acquired during marriage

tab_procedure.title: Family Case Procedures
tab_procedure.subtitle: Family Case Process
tab_procedure.topic_detail_1_1: • Family counseling: To reduce conflict and emotional impact
tab_procedure.topic_detail_1_2: • Mediation: To seek resolution before legal proceedings
tab_procedure.topic_detail_2_1: • Filing for divorce or alimony claims
tab_procedure.topic_detail_2_2: • Asset division and child custody arrangements

familyTypes.title: Divorce
familyTypes.description: Filing for divorce due to family issues or failure to fulfill marital conditions
familyTypes.punishment: Divorce affects legal rights and duties, such as child custody or asset division
familyTypes.examples: Divorce due to conflict, requesting asset division upon divorce

familyTypes_2.title: Alimony Claims
familyTypes_2.description: Claims for child or spousal support as required by law
familyTypes_2.punishment: Alimony determined by the court based on financial status of the spouse or parent
familyTypes_2.examples: Child support claims, spousal support claims after divorce

familyTypes_3.title: Property Division
familyTypes_3.description: Division of assets acquired during marriage or after divorce
familyTypes_3.punishment: Asset division based on agreement or court determination
familyTypes_3.examples: Division of assets acquired during marriage, jointly acquired property division

procedures_1.title: Filing or Mediation
procedures_1.description: The involved parties file a petition to the court to resolve family issues

procedures_2.title: Evidence Verification and Collection
procedures_2.description: The court verifies evidence to support the decision-making process

procedures_3.title: Case Hearing
procedures_3.description: The court considers evidence and legal principles to ensure justice for all parties

procedures_4.title: Enforcement of Judgment
procedures_4.description: The involved parties adhere to the court's judgment as prescribed
